## Step I

```{r  step_I}

# Q1
  # import data 
step_i_df <- tribble(
  ~'x',  ~'y',
  17, 1963, 
  21, 1997, 
  25, 2046, 
  29, 2051, 
  33, 2059, 
  37, 2071,
  41, 2094,) %>%
  data.frame() %>% 
  # data manipulation
  mutate(x_inv = 1/(x + 273))
  

# Q2
  # fit a straight line
  # define linear fit
step_i_fit <- lm(step_i_df$y ~ step_i_df$x_inv)
  # record coefficients
step_i_coef <- step_i_fit %>%
  coef()
  
  # show coefficients
tibble(intercept = step_i_coef[1], 
       slope = step_i_coef[2]) %>%
  kable()
  # visualize
step_i_df %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = x_inv, y = y)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_abline(intercept = step_i_coef[1], 
       slope = step_i_coef[2])
  
# Q3 
  # calculations
R <- 8.3144598
delta_h <- -R * step_i_coef[2]
delta_s <- R * step_i_coef[1]
# Q4
  # Demonstrative visualizations

```

$$ \Delta G = \Delta H- T \Delta S = -RTlnK$$ $$lnK = -\frac{\Delta H}{R}\frac{1}{T} + \frac{\Delta S}{R}$$ Hence slope = $-\frac{\Delta H}{R}$ and intercept = $\frac{\Delta S}{R}$ R defined as $8.3144598 \frac{J}{mol K}$ $$ \Delta H = - R * slope; \Delta S = R * intercept$$
